## SDQ vs CHS

SDQ vs CHS: The Perfect Tool for Comparing Questionnaires When psychologists want to measure children's psychological attributes, they often resort to behavioural screening questionnaires like Strength and Difficiencies Questionnaire (SDQ) and Children's Hopefulness Scale (CHS). However, comparing these instruments can be a daunting task, if performed manually. Thus, there's a pressing need for harmonisation, an objective tool that can help researchers compare such instruments efficiently. This is where Harmony steps in, a unique software that simplifies 'SDQ vs CHS' comparison. Harmony uses large language models to compare the items in SDQ and CHS. It can provide you with a percentage match between each item in these questionnaires, thus saving hours of work and subjective biases. The functioning isn't just limited to manual data entry, you can select instruments directly from Harmony's database or simply drag and drop your own instruments (PDF form) into Harmony's web interface. The tool does an excellent job when it comes to 'SDQ vs CHS' comparison, streamlining the task for psychologists and social scientists. In addition to English, Harmony can also compare items in multiple languages enabling a global usability of the tool. The constant evolution and changes in social dynamics make it essential for repeat longitudinal analysis across a number of studies. With Harmony, you can end your woes of 'SDQ vs CHS' comparison, and easily determine whether results are consistent across studies, or vary in response to the changing social tissue. Try Harmony today to facilitate a smoother comparison of different assessment instruments.

## Compare the items in SDQ and CHS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and CHS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CHS into Harmony</a> - compare CHS with other instruments
